qas.question: Along with convection, what provokes rain in the Plymouth area?
Along with winter, in what season are Atlantic depressions most prevalent?
About how many inches of rain fall on Plymouth every year?
Along with March, what month has the fastest winds on average?
From what direction do most of the winds blow on Plymouth?

context: Rainfall tends to be associated with <a0_0>Atlantic depressions<a0_0/> or with convection. The Atlantic depressions are more vigorous in <a1_0>autumn<a1_0/> and winter and most of the rain which falls in those seasons in the <a4_0>south-west<a4_0/> is from this source. Average annual rainfall is around 980 millimetres (<a2_0>39<a2_0/> in). <a3_0>November<a3_0/> to March have the highest mean wind speeds, with June to August having the lightest winds. The predominant wind direction is from the south-west.
